page.title: 05Local history
page.content:
Local history
There are no ancient monuments or museums in these parts. When the Scottish kings resided at Stirling castle they hunted wild boar in this district. Hence the name Muckhart meaning hill of the wild boar. The original spelling was MUCARD from the gaelic MUC- a pig and ARD a hill or height. Over the years this changed to Muchart then to its present Muckhart. The hill behind the village has a strange name Seamab. No-one knows the origin or meaning of this word. Of the Standing Stone on Castleton Farm there is no local knowledge of its history.
